weather_report:
As dawn breaks over Downtown San Francisco, the city sits enveloped in a blanket of gentle cloud cover that shrouds the skyline in shades of grey. The air is cool, with temperatures lingering around the mid-forties, a familiar chill that eases into day as the sun begins its ascent. Currently, there is a whisper of drizzle in the air, adding a splash of moisture to the atmosphere that complements the soft murmur of the winds gusting from the west. The chance of precipitation lingers around a modest 40%, hinting at fleeting showers that may grace your umbrella throughout the day.

As Friday unfolds, anticipate a gradual lifting of the overcast, revealing patches of blue that hint at the sun’s return, although temperatures are set to cool slightly in the afternoon. The promise of a mostly sunny day holds an allure, especially as the morning fog gives way to clearer skies, one can envision the silhouettes of the Golden Gate standing tall against a backdrop of crisp visibility. Dress in layers—perhaps a light sweater and a jacket—to adapt to the shifting temperatures, and don’t forget the sturdy footwear for an afternoon stroll along the Embarcadero. A visit to the Ferry Building for artisan coffee and baked goods would be a delightful way to immerse yourself in the flavors of the city, while the brisk winds invite a cozy shared moment at home, perhaps with a well-worn book and a steaming mug.
